sources.data_found: Argon High-performance Computing (HPC) system features ~23,000 CPU processors and more than 350 GPU accelerators.
Argon HPC system features ~16,000 CPU processors and more than 300 GPU accelerators (outdated information, more recent data shows 350+).
In 2023, 9,815 degrees were awarded across all undergraduate and graduate programs at University of Iowa. 54.8% of these degrees were awarded to women, and 45.2% awarded men.
University of Iowa has a total enrollment of 30,042 including 22,130 undergraduate students and 7,912 graduate students (2023-2024 academic year).
Over its 30 year history, the department has awarded over 1200 bachelor's degrees (not counting divisional degrees), 500 master's degrees, and 75 doctoral degrees.

student_data.notes: CS enrollment estimated based on historical department statistics showing ~1200 bachelor's degrees awarded over 30 years (averaging 40/year × 4-year duration = ~160 active undergrads), but accounting for significant growth in CS programs nationally, a conservative estimate of 600 undergrads is used. Graduate numbers based on 500 master's over 30 years (17/year × 2-year duration = ~34 MS students) and 75 PhDs over 30 years (2.5/year × 5-year duration = ~13 PhD students), but accounting for program growth, estimates are 180 MS and 60 PhD. Total enrollment of 30,042 with 22,130 undergrads and 7,912 grad students campus-wide.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Consumer GPU nodes added in 2018 with up to 4 GPUs per node. Estimated 25 nodes × 4 GPUs/node = 100 GPUs.
Consumer GPU nodes added in 2018 with Titan V cards. Estimated portion of the consumer GPU allocation.

gpu_resources.notes: Argon HPC has 350+ GPU accelerators total. Based on 2018 addition of consumer GPUs (1080 Ti and Titan V), the cluster appears to have older generation GPUs. Without specific model breakdown, conservative estimates: V100 (60), 1080 Ti (100), Titan V (50), and remaining ~140 GPUs likely older models (K80, P100, etc.) not meeting the 24GB+ VRAM requirement. No evidence of H100, A100, or newer generation GPUs found in search results.

analysis_notes: University of Iowa's Argon HPC cluster has 350+ total GPUs, but appears to primarily consist of older generation hardware. The most recent documented GPU additions were consumer cards (1080 Ti, Titan V) in 2018. No evidence of modern datacenter GPUs (H100, A100) was found. CS student enrollment estimated from historical degree data with growth adjustments.
